page.title: 15THE TIBSHELF BLACKSMITH
page.content: My brother-in-law is a blacksmith and he runs his own business in Tibshelf. He has got his own forge and his own tools like hammers, long-handled pliers and an anvil. When he is going to make a horseshoe he takes a long bar of iron, chops a piece off it and puts it into the forge. When he gets it out he uses long-handled pliers. It will be very hot so that he can beat it into shape. He uses a hammer to get it into the right shape. Then he has to make the holes where the nails go. Farmers don't use horses to work in the fields these days, but there are lots of people who ride horses for fun. He shoes horses for people in Tibshelf but he has a van and he also goes round to other villages and to horse shows. by Steven (11)
